image.altText: Alison McNeice used government concessions to be able to buy her first home 2026-01-08 11:01:00

props.synopsis: Making use of a number of first homebuyer schemes in Tasmania gave Alison "freedom" from the rental market. But, a number of those schemes are due to expire in a few months.

title.children: Tasmania's first homebuyer concessions aid prospective buyers, but for how long?

image.altText: Two Tasmania Police officers stand next to a patrol car.

props.synopsis: A 66-year-old man has died from injuries police allege were sustained in an assault at a popular Hobart shopping strip.

title.children: Two men charged with manslaughter over alleged Hobart CBD assault

image.altText: A photo of two smiling men with the sea behind them

props.synopsis: The "swift action" of members of the public has been praised in the rescue of a 74-year-old man who became separated from his boat.

title.children: Two boaties pulled a man from the sea. He only ever said four words.

image.altText: An older woman in a green jumper sitting in a park.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman who was forced to give up her newborn daughter in 1969 says decisions about a planned redress scheme, which appear to have been made ahead of consultation, have made her feel worthless.

title.children: Forced adoption survivor says Tas compensation figure 'totally inadequate'

image.altText: Tasmania Police crime scene tape seen against a backdrop of foliage.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man has died after his quad bike crashed on a forestry road in northern Tasmania, with police saying it is the third serious all-terrain vehicle crash in recent weeks.

title.children: Man riding with friends killed after quad bike hits stump, police say

image.altText: Heavily armed Danish troops in fatigues face the camera with snow in the background.

props.synopsis: At least three options have been floated for Donald Trump to achieve his goal of taking Greenland for the United States.

title.children: Three options the US is considering to take Greenland

image.altText: US President Donald Trump gestures.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has said that "only time will tell" how long the United States will maintain oversight of Venezuela.

title.children: Trump says US oversight of Venezuela could last for years

image.altText: Princess Catherine in profile with a dark hat and brown checked blazer and light on her face

props.synopsis: Catherine turns 44 today as she resets royal life with fewer public appearances, tighter boundaries and a strong emphasis on family life — a choice shaped by loss, illness and the pressure of being next in line.

title.children: As she turns 44, Princess Catherine is quietly reshaping royal life

image.altText: Travis Head of Australia looks on with Steve Smith

props.synopsis: The internet went wild as Australia dominated with the bat, led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, and England crumbled in the dying embers of the Ashes.

title.children: How the internet reacted to the fifth Ashes Test

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and wearing glasses stands next to a police officer in uniform.

props.synopsis: A brazen heist at Port Vila International Airport has stunned Vanuatu and become the talk of a nation unused to such overtly public acts of crime.

title.children: 'Like a movie': The brazen airport heist that stunned a Pacific nation

image.altText: A smiling woman with long brown hair, wearing a light brown checked blazer, sitting in an office

props.synopsis: After Randa Abdel-Fattah was dropped from Adelaide Writers' Week by the Adelaide Festival Board, a slew of authors, including Michelle de Kretser, have withdrawn from the event.

title.children: Authors withdraw from festival after Palestinian Australian author dropped

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: In December, a Supreme Court jury convicted former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh of murdering the 24-year-old at Wangetti Beach, north of Cairns.

title.children: Man convicted of Toyah Cordingley's murder files appeal

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: The deputy governor of the Reserve Bank Andrew Hauser confirms the news mortgage borrowers would not have wanted to hear — interest rates are highly unlikely to head lower anytime soon.

title.children: 'Let's be clear, it's too high': RBA deputy downplays easing inflation

image.altText: A male cricketer in white wearing a helmet and holding a bat.

props.synopsis: Harry Brook was fined $60,000 and has apologised for bringing "embarrassment" to the English cricket team in a scuffle with a bouncer shortly before the Ashes.

title.children: Harry Brook fined $60k for nightclub scuffle before pre-Ashes match

image.altText: Australia's Travis Head pulls a face while wearing his player of the match medal after the final Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: Here are the player ratings from a one-sided Ashes series with a few stand-outs and perhaps more flame-outs across the five Tests.

title.children: Ashes report card: Australia and England player ratings

image.altText: Rinky Hijikata in tennis gear and holding a racquet, holding his hand to his mouth and looking frustrated.

props.synopsis: Rinky Hijikata's three-set loss to big-serving Frenchman Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard means there are no Australians left in the Brisbane International singles.

title.children: Last Aussie out of Brisbane International after Hijikata suffers three-set loss

image.altText: A standing fan in a bedroom

props.synopsis: The study by Griffith University in Brisbane finds that a room temperature while sleeping of more than 24 degrees Celsius increases heart rate variability and physiological stress.

title.children: Study finds link between room temperature and sleep stress for elderly

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit and a swimming cap holds goggles over her head while smiling on a boat, with water dripping down.

props.synopsis: There is no lounging by the pool for these travellers, who are spending a week swimming the remote waters of the Turkish Lycian coast.

title.children: Older travellers 'feel good every day' with exercise-based holidays

image.altText: Yasmine beams while standing in a granny flat kitchen that's different shades of green. She wears a green shirt and jean jacket.

props.synopsis: We chat with inimitable interior designer Yasmine Ghoniem ahead of Grand Designs Transformations series two to learn how she made it, her hot design takes, and what to expect from this season.

title.children: The two biggest renovation mistakes, according to this design show host

image.altText: A police bearcat vehicle on the move during the ongoing search for Kenneth Giles.

props.synopsis: Police have issued a "personal plea" for Kenneth John Giles to turn himself in, almost 24 hours after a shooting in Mullewa.

title.children: Victim flown to Perth as search for Midwest shooter escalates

image.altText: A man with brown hair taking a selfi

props.synopsis: Isaac James Martin, 31, says he has not "bothered" to get legal representation, telling a Brisbane court he "killed old mate because he's a child molester".

title.children: 'I killed old mate': Prisoner confesses to killing 'child molester' inmate

image.altText: Damien Martyn and Adam Gilchrist celebrate a Test victory for Australia in 2004.

props.synopsis: Adam Gilchrist says his former Australia teammate Damien Martyn has been released from a Gold Coast hospital.

title.children: Ex-Test cricketer Martyn returns home after waking from induced coma

image.altText: A triptych of three images from female social media influencers with text graphics overlaid

props.synopsis: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

title.children: How the 'American in Australia' trend reveals something about us and them

image.altText: torn apart car on fence

props.synopsis: The teenagers suffered serious leg injuries after the allegedly stolen car crashed into a fence in the early hours of the morning.

title.children: 13yo boys 'extremely lucky' to survive crash during police chase

image.altText: A vintage teel and white car

props.synopsis: Australia’s biggest car festival roars to life amid a scorching heatwave, thrill-seeking crowds and strict policing.

title.children: Australia's largest car festival revs into action amid soaring temperatures

image.altText: Garry McDonald as Norman Gunston, combing his hair.

props.synopsis: From Academy Award-winning performances to classic Australian comedy, fill the last moments of your holidays with these free movies and TV series.

title.children: The best movies and TV series you can watch now — no fee required

image.altText: Man with short dark hair and beard, dressed in a black zipped up jacket, arrives outside a theatre.

props.synopsis: Lawyer Alan Jackson gave no reason for quitting but says that under California law, his client is definitely not guilty of murdering his parents, Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner.

title.children: Nick Reiner's high-profile lawyer quits as public defenders take over

image.altText: Lachie Neale talking to media

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions will not stand in the way of Lachie Neale if the club's former co-captain chooses to return to Perth at the end of the season.

title.children: Neale has Lions' 'blessing' if he wants to return to Perth after 2026 season

image.altText: An adult female mountain gorilla cuddles two twin babies.

props.synopsis: A mountain gorilla named Mafuko has given birth to twins, a "rare and remarkable event", in Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title.children: Rare twin mountain gorillas born in African national park

image.altText: A man in high vis at a press conference

props.synopsis: Brisbane's mayor says it "should have been obvious" the venue would close as the stadium at Victoria Park was announced early last year.

title.children: Couples 'blindsided' as wedding venue closed to make way for Olympic Stadium

image.altText: A composite image of two smiling boys, one in a black basketball top with a medal around his neck and the other in a white top.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives lay further murder charges over the high-profile deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer suburbs last September.

title.children: Police lay further charges over Melbourne boys' stabbing deaths

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

title.children: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know

image.altText: An aerial shot of old cane fields and farming land near a river

props.synopsis: The state government approves a 150-site tourist park with 95 conditions despite ongoing environmental concerns from authorities and community groups.

title.children: Controversial 150-site  'eco-tourism' project approved for Queensland

image.altText: A group of men in maroon shirts playing tug of war.

props.synopsis: The ancient sport of tug of war is being kept alive in Brisbane by an enthusiastic team, and some are calling for it to return to the Olympics.

title.children: The Brisbane team pulling together to keep an ancient sport alive
